name: Modes of Movement

description: A walk represents unhurried but purposeful move- minute or two before having to rest for a minute (see Run, page ment at 3 miles per hour for an unencumbered human. 144).
name: Walk

description: Difficult ter- rain, obstacles, or poor visibility can hamper movement. When movement is hampered, each square moved into usu- ally counts as two squares, effectively reducing the distance that a character can cover in a move. For example, a character moving through difficult terrain (such as undergrowth) pays 2 squares of movement per square moved into (double the normal cost). If more than one condition applies, multiply together all additional costs that apply. (This is a specific exception to the normal rule for doubling; see page 304.) For instance, a character moving through diffi- cult terrain in darkness would pay 4 squares of movement per square moved into (double cost times double cost is quadruple cost). In some situations, your movement may be so hampered that you don’t have sufficient speed even to move 5 163 Illus. by J. Jarvis ADVENTURING CHAPTER 9: Table 9–5: Terrain and Overland Movement Run: A character can’t run for an extended period of time. Terrain Highway Road or Trail Trackless Attempts to run and rest in cycles effectively work out to a hustle. Desert, sandy ×1 ×1/2 ×1/2 Terrain: The terrain through which a character travels affects Forest ×1 ×1 ×1/2 how much distance he or she can cover in an hour or a day (see Hills ×1 ×3/4 ×1/2 Table 9–5: Terrain and Overland Movement). Travel is quickest on a Jungle ×1 ×3/4 ×1/4 highway, not quite as fast on a road or trail, and slowest through Moor ×1 ×1 ×3/4 trackless terrain. A highway is a straight, major, paved road. A road is Mountains ×3/4 ×3/4 ×1/2 typically a dirt track. A trail is like a road, except that it allows only Plains ×1 ×1 ×3/4 single-file travel and does not benefit a party traveling with vehicles. Swamp ×1 ×3/4 ×1/2 Trackless terrain is a wild area with no paths. Tundra, frozen ×1 ×3/4 ×3/4
name: Hampered Movement

name: Example of Breaking an Object

description: Split treasure evenly among the characters on Strength checks to break open doors as follows: Fine –16, who participated. Some characters may be of higher level than Diminutive –12, Tiny –8, Small –4, Large +4, Huge +8, Gargantuan others, or some might happen to have done more on a particular +12, Colossal +16. adventure than others did, but the simplest, fastest, and best policy is to split treasure up evenly. 167 Illus. by J. Foster Lidda savors the rewards of opening the treasure chest. ADVENTURING CHAPTER 9:
name: Splitting Treasure

description: No saving throw is allowed. a saving throw. It simply is dealt the appropriate damage.
name: None

description: The term “Hit Dice” is used synonymously with Light: Object shines like a torch. “character levels” for effects that affect a number of Hit Dice of
name: Hit Dice

description: 5-pound telekinesis.
name: Mage Hand

description: Makes minor repairs on an object. which is defined as the caster’s class level for the purpose of casting a
name: Mending

description: Whispered conversation at distance. Pyrotechnics: Turns fire into blinding light or choking smoke. Open/Close: Opens or closes small or light things. Rage: Gives +2 to Str and Con, +1 on Will saves, –2 to AC.
name: Message

description: Subject gains +1 on saving throws. Silence: Negates sound in 15-ft. radius.
name: Resistance

description: Summons one instrument of the caster’s Sound Burst: Deals 1d8 sonic damage to subjects; may stun them. choice. Suggestion: Compels subject to follow stated course of action.
name: Summon Instrument

description: Speak any language. Alarm: Wards an area for 2 hours/level.
name: Tongues

description: Sends a short message 1 mile/level.
name: Whispering Wind

description: Makes a rope move at your command.
name: Animate Rope

description: Cures 1d8 damage +1/level (max +5). Clairaudience/Clairvoyance: Hear or see at a distance for 1
name: Cure Light Wounds

description: Reveals hidden doors within 60 ft. min./level.
name: Detect Secret Doors

description: Changes your appearance. Confusion: Subjects behave oddly for 1 round/level.
name: Disguise Self

description: Your speed increases by 30 ft. saves, and checks.
name: Expeditious Retreat

description: Cures 3d8 damage +1/level (max +15).
name: Cure Serious Wounds

description: Makes 10-ft. square or one object slippery.
name: Grease

description: 60-ft. radius of bright light.
name: Daylight

description: Attacks miss subject 50%.
name: Displacement

description: Subject becomes insubstantial and can fly slowly.
name: Gaseous Form

description: Masks object against scrying.
name: Obscure Object

description: Commands subject of 7 HD or less.
name: Geas, Lesser
